content: each section you should have 22 stitches between markers and 88 total repeat rounds 1 and 2 steadily decreasing by 2 stitches in each section until you have 6 stitches between each marker almost final round k1 k2tog k2tog k1 repeat until eor final round k2tog all remaining stitches while removing stitch markers you should have 8 stitches remaining leaving a 9 tail break your yarn and do a little wiggle finishing you made it if you have a favorite way to finish go for it my recommendation is to weave in your ends but hey - i won t judge you maybe you want to leave them trailing to attract cats once you make that choice the same goes for blocking - totally up to you no matter what you decide attach your white pompom every minnesotan flag needs its star after all place on your head or that of a loved one repeat your little wiggle and accept all due praise maybe ask for a hotdish i personally love the button method for attaching pompoms and i recommend it - especially if you re using a fur pompom simply thread the strings of your pompom through the top of your hat about 1 apart on the inside of the crown thread each string through the hole of a flat 1 button tie in a bow this method not only allows a bit of added stability to the pompom but makes it easy to remove when you need to wash your creation abbreviations k = knit p = purl sl = slip sm = stitch marker pm = place marker ssk = slip slip knit for a left-leaning decrease k2tog = knit two stitches together for a right-leaning decrease bor = beginning of round eor = end of round mc = main color cc = contrasting color we can also use complimentary but only if it s very flattering | = in chart symbol for slipped stitch
